intro: Draba sornborgeri, commonly known as the Sornborg's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a small, herbaceous annual with basal leaves and a flowering stem that bears clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Draba sornborgeri is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
